author: Jan Skutch
title: Former Chatham County deputy Rick Hall admits state child molestation charges, sentenced to 15 years in prison
text:
Photos Richard Hall Related Stories Former Chatham County deputy sentenced to 17 years in federal prison in child porn case Ex-Chatham County deputy pleads guilty to producing child porn at Wilmington Island home By Jan Skutch Former Chatham County Deputy Sheriff Lt. Richard Adam “Rick” Hall on Friday pleaded guilty to a 25-count indictment charging him with child molestation and related charges and was sentenced to 15 years in state prison.
The sentence from Chatham County Superior Court Judge Timothy R. Walmsley is concurrent to a 17-year federal sentence imposed Sept. 21, and resulted from a negotiated plea between prosecutors and defense attorney Richard Darden.
The state charges were contained in an eight-page indictment returned March 5, 2014, involving four separate victims beginning on Feb. 14, 2006, and continuing until Nov. 21, 2010.
Assistant District Attorney Emily Puhala had withheld acting on the indictment while the federal case proceeded.
There is no parole in federal sentences. In addition to the custody term imposed by U.S. District Chief Judge Lisa Godbey Wood also sentenced Hall, 53, to supervised release “for the rest of your life” once he is released from prison and said he must register as a sex offender.
He, a deputy sheriff for 28 years, was arrested Dec. 20, 2013, and has remained in custody since then.
He was fired March 7, 2014, two days after the Chatham County grand jury returned the indictment.
